snippet: President Obama directed his attorney general to review how the death penalty is applied in the United States and called a botched execution in Oklahoma “deeply disturbing.”
abstract: Pres Obama directs Atty Gen Eric H Holder Jr to review how death penalty is applied in United States at time when it has become increasingly debated; calls botched execution of Clayton Darrell Lockett in Oklahoma 'deeply disturbing,' broaching polarizing subject that he has rarely discussed; observers say comments could foreshadow eventual shift in his position supporting death penalty.
lead_paragraph: President Obama directed his attorney general to review how the death penalty is applied in the United States and called a botched execution in Oklahoma “deeply disturbing.”

headline.main: Obama Orders Policy Review on Executions
headline.print_headline: Obama Orders Policy Review on Executions
